inputs.remark:
Visit调整为
V1 Initial Audiologic Evaluation
V2 ENT Consultation
V3 Vestibular Assessment
V4 Psychiatric Evaluation
V5 Hearing Aid Fitting
V6 6-Month Follow-up

logic_summary: Replaced the single 'encounters' entry with the 6 specific visits requested in REMARKS.
Preserved detailed data for V1 (Initial Audiologic Evaluation).
Populated V2 (ENT), V3 (Vestibular), V4 (Psychiatric), V5 (Fitting), and V6 (6-Month Follow-up) with data extracted from the case text.
Included 1-month follow-up outcomes within the V5 Hearing Aid Fitting visit as outcome data.

history.present_illness: Patient reports loud ringing tinnitus in the right ear beginning 2 months ago following a gunshot wound to the shoulder and retirement. Tinnitus is constant and louder at night. He also reports 5 episodes of dizziness (10-20 seconds) in the last 2 months; one resulted in a fall.
history.otologic_history: History of bilateral ear infections once a year since youth (most recent 11 months ago). No prior vestibular issues.
history.noise_exposure_history: 36 years in law enforcement. Monthly shooting range training for 25 years. Occasional hearing protection used. Close proximity to gunfire.
history.medical_psych_history: Type 2 diabetes, high cholesterol, headaches. Recent gunshot wound to right shoulder (2 months ago). 'In shock' since shooting; flashbacks and nightmares (PTSD symptoms). Mother recently diagnosed with dementia.
history.prior_management: Prescribed antibiotics for gunshot wound. Uses aspirin, metformin, dapagliflozin, simvastatin.
history.patient_goals: Reduce tinnitus bother and address dizziness.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear: Normal low frequencies sloping precipitously to severe mixed hearing loss in mid-to-high frequencies. Left ear: Normal low-to-mid frequencies sloping to moderate mixed loss in high frequencies. Air-bone gaps present at 250, 1000, and 4000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: Speech Recognition Thresholds (SRT) consistent with pure-tone findings. Word Recognition Scores (WRS) excellent in the right ear and good in the left ear.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.key_findings: Normal ear canal volumes. Type A tympanograms bilaterally, though right ear pressure is negative (-95 daPa).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.key_findings: Right ipsilateral reflexes absent at 500, 1000, 2000 Hz. Left ipsilateral reflexes absent at 500 Hz, present at 1000 and 2000 Hz.

tests.name: Otoacoustic Emissions (DPOAE)
tests.key_findings: Right ear: Pass at 3000 Hz, refer at 1500, 2000, 4000-6000 Hz. Left ear: Pass 1500-4000 Hz, refer 5000-6000 Hz. Consistent with pure-tone loss.

tests.name: Tinnitus Functional Index (TFI)
tests.key_findings: Results suggest tinnitus has a significant negative impact on daily life.

history.referral_reason: Asymmetrical hearing thresholds and unilateral tinnitus.

tests.name: Physical Examination
tests.key_findings: Unremarkable. No suspicion of medication-induced tinnitus.

tests.name: MRI
tests.key_findings: Unremarkable bilaterally. No significant anatomical anomalies.

value.key_findings: Suspects mixed hearing loss components are related to long-term history of bilateral otitis media.
value.plan: Medical clearance for amplification provided. Referral for psychological evaluation.

tests.name: Videonystagmography (VNG)
tests.key_findings: Within normal limits. Slight nystagmus noted during gaze testing (insignificant).

tests.name: Positional and Caloric Testing
tests.key_findings: Within normal limits. No vestibular symptoms noted during testing.

history.referral_reason: Referral from ENT for stress/PTSD management.

value.key_findings: Diagnosed with PTSD related to shooting involvement. Flashbacks and nightmares exacerbating tinnitus and vestibular issues. Guilt regarding partner's injury.

value.treatment: Bilateral Widex Evoke 440 receiver-in-the-canal (RIC) instruments with Widex Zen Therapy (Zen Lavender, Zen noise, Zen Aqua). Custom-molded earplugs with filters.
value.outcome: At 1-month follow-up: High satisfaction, 14 hours/day use. Tinnitus less noticeable. AzBio in quiet: 94% aided (vs 76% unaided).

history.interim: Reported reduction in tinnitus annoyance. One episode of lightheadedness attributed to dehydration. Completed 20 weeks of CBT with significant reduction in anxiety.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Slight improvement in low frequencies in right ear (resolution of conductive components). Asymmetrical high-frequency loss persists.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear: High compliance (excessive tympanic membrane mobility). Left ear: Normal.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.key_findings: Absent at all tested frequencies bilaterally.
